What is an important limitation to consider when creating a PBaaS chain using the Verus Desktop, especially with regards to existing currencies like BTC or ETH?

When using the Verus Desktop to create a PBaaS chain, you cannot use the same names as existing currencies that are already supported, such as BTC or ETH. This limitation is currently considered errata for the testnet release, but it will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.

2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.# DisclaimerThis is experimental and unfinished software. Use at your own risk! Why might antivirus software like Avast or Kaspersky flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Antivirus software might flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (potentially unwanted program) because it includes mining software, which could be installed by a third party to exploit your PC. This is a false positive, and you can learn more about it by reviewing the resources provided.
